posts.post_content:
Posted By: leon
I am contemplating selling my personal collection of 19th Century cards. I would prefer to sell the whole thing but would consider piece mealing it out. The Kelly Four Base Hits is included.....regards


[IMG]http://luckeycards.com/pn690fourbasehitskelley.jpg[/IMG]
 

[url]http://www.luckeycards.com/personal.html[/url]

edited to fix link for you Leon

Posted By: Steve
Wow nice stuff Leon!!  

Good luck with your sales!!


Steve

Posted By: Bruce Kasarda
Leon, beautiful collection. I tried to E Mail you but it got returned. Drop me a line I am interested in some of your cards. Thanks

Posted By: Paul
Leon, say it ain't so.  The 19th Century collecting world will miss you badly.  I see for the very next thread that you are interested in a Bobby Mathews, so maybe you've changed your mind already.  If you do decide to sell, I'd certainly be interested in quite a few that you have, but sadly can't buy the whole lot.

Posted By: leon
I don't want to piecemeal this out for the time being. This is not a distressed sale or I would have given it to Mastro or Huggins & Scott, Lelands, Goodwin, Sloate, or some other reputable company.....I will upate the board if it will be sold together, piecemeal, or not at all, in the next few days. Thanks for all of the emails....I doubt I will peacemeal it out though...

Posted By: leon
Bruce- I sent you an email....

Paul- I am just a type collector guy...not really hard core 19th Century..though I do like them.....Keeping them wouldn't be a bad alternative....we'll see how it goes..

Posted By: leon
In the near future I will be selling the rest of the 19th century cards I have.....the Four Base Hits and the H812 are gone.....thanks again....btw, not sure how I will be selling the rest but most likely it will be for American money [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG].......just not sure of the venue if not privately....

Posted By: DD
Congrats on the sale; the end of an era.  Are you going to change your avatar?

Posted By: Paul
Are you going to maintain your 20th century type collection?

Posted By: leon
I will change my avatar to my fave 20th century card in the near future......I will still be an addicted 20th century collector.
regards
leon

Posted By: Jason L
It's gotta be the 1987 Fleer Bill Ripken, I would think.
